intro: Centaurium quadrifolium var. linariifolium, commonly known as the four-leaved centaury, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Gentianaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. Its leaves are opposite and often have a distinctive four-leaf pattern, which contributes to its common name. It is valued in traditional herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
